decks.notes: The primary strategy of this Doomsday combo deck is to assemble the necessary cards to cast Doomsday and set up a winning combination of Thassa's Oracle and Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student. The deck includes key cards like Dark Ritual and Lion's Eye Diamond to generate mana quickly, along with disruptive cards like Thoughtseize and Force of Will to protect the combo. With efficient card draw from Ponder, Brainstorm, and Consider, the deck aims to quickly dig through the library and win the game in a single turn.

The deck focuses on using powerful combo pieces like Show and Tell, Sneak Attack, and Omniscience to cheat out huge threats such as Emrakul, the Aeons Torn and Griselbrand. By using cards like Ponder, Brainstorm, and Stock Up to set up the combo and protect it with Force of Will and Flusterstorm, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with its high-impact plays. City of Traitors and Ancient Tomb provide accelerated mana while Atraxa, Grand Unifier offers additional protection and utility. The deck aims to quickly dominate the game through its synergy and explosive plays.

The main goal of this deck is to maintain control of the board with disruptive spells like Thoughtseize and Force of Will, while applying pressure with efficient creatures like Murktide Regent and Nethergoyf. Utilizing cards like Brainstorm and Ponder to draw into threats, the deck aims to tempo out opponents by disrupting their game plan and chipping away at their life total. The mana base is focused on providing consistent access to both blue and black mana sources, with Wasteland included to disrupt opponent's mana bases.

The main concept of this deck is to use the combo of Show and Tell to cheat out powerful creatures like Emrakul, the Aeons Torn and Atraxa, Grand Unifier onto the battlefield for free. The deck seeks to control the game with counterspells like Force of Will and Veil of Summer while digging for combo pieces with Brainstorm and Ponder. Cards like Cunning Wish and Stock Up provide additional utility and searching options. The goal is to quickly ramp into an Omniscience, allowing the player to cast spells for free and overwhelm the opponent with powerful threats.

This deck focuses on utilizing a mix of powerful control spells and card draw to maintain board presence and disrupt the opponent's strategies. It includes powerful control elements like Force of Will and Swords to Plowshares, as well as card advantage engines like Brainstorm and Ponder. The deck also includes a variety of versatile threats and answers, such as Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath and Teferi, Time Raveler. By carefully managing resources and controlling the flow of the game, this deck aims to outlast the opponent and secure victory through gradual advantage accumulation.

The primary focus of this Grixis Control deck is to disrupt and control the opponent's game plan while establishing card advantage through efficient removal spells, countermagic, and card draw. The deck utilizes a combination of hand disruption, removal, and powerful threats like Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student and Kaito, Bane of Nightmares to control the board and overwhelm the opponent. By utilizing a mix of control elements and threats, the deck aims to maintain control of the game and outvalue the opponent in the long run.

The main concept of this deck is to assemble powerful artifact combos using cards like Mystic Forge, Urza's Workshop, and Ancient Tomb to generate mana and cast big threats such as Glaring Fleshraker and Karn, the Great Creator. Key pieces like Manifold Key and Voltaic Key can help untap artifacts for extra value, while cards like Tezzeret, Cruel Captain and Ugin, Eye of the Storms provide additional support and control options. The goal is to overwhelm your opponent with a fast and efficient artifact-based combo strategy.

The deck focuses on controlling the game by utilizing lands to disrupt the opponent's strategy. It aims to lock down the opponent's resources using cards like Wasteland and Bojuka Bog, while slowly building up its own win condition with cards like Dark Depths and Thespian's Stage. It also includes various ways to protect its key pieces and disrupt the opponent's plays, such as Karakas and Pithing Needle. The deck uses cards like Life from the Loam and Exploration to generate value and maintain its land advantage, ultimately overpowering the opponent through resource denial and strategic land manipulation.

The key concept of this deck revolves around utilizing low-cost and efficient spells to control the board while aggressively attacking with evasive threats like Dragon's Rage Channeler and Murktide Regent. By combining tempo play with powerful card selection and disruption from cards like Force of Will and Daze, the deck aims to keep the opponent on their back foot and quickly close out the game. The mana base is streamlined to support the deck's aggressive game plan, ensuring consistent access to the necessary colors and mana sources.

The focus of this deck is to quickly and efficiently fill the graveyard with creatures and spells, before using a combination of cards such as Balustrade Spy and Undercity Informer to mill the entire library, allowing for a win condition with Thassa's Oracle or Dread Return. The deck utilizes a mix of fast mana sources, protection in the form of Pact of Negation, and disruption through cards like Cabal Therapy and Thoughtseize to ensure the combo can be executed successfully. The goal is to win the game in one explosive turn, catching opponents off guard.

This deck focuses on utilizing Gaea's Cradle to generate massive amounts of mana to cast powerful creatures and spells quickly. It includes cards like Natural Order, Green Sun's Zenith, and Endurance to search for key creatures and disrupt opponent's strategies. The deck also includes protection cards like Sylvan Safekeeper and Once Upon a Time to provide versatility and resilience against removal and control decks. With a mix of ramp, control, and powerful finishers like Craterhoof Behemoth, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents with its efficient use of resources and threats.

The main strategy of this deck is to utilize the Dark Depths combo to create a 20/20 Marit Lage token. The deck includes various cards to help search for Dark Depths and Thespian's Stage, as well as protect the combo with cards like Sylvan Safekeeper and Gaddock Teeg. Additionally, the deck includes cards like Life from the Loam and Mox Diamond to provide additional resources and consistency. The goal is to quickly assemble the Dark Depths combo while disrupting the opponent's game plan with cards like Swords to Plowshares and Wasteland.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly and efficiently cast a series of low-cost spells to mill your entire library and win the game with Thassa's Oracle or Fell the Profane. The deck aims to use cards like Simian Spirit Guide and Lotus Petal to accelerate your mana and cast spells like Dark Ritual and Cabal Ritual to generate additional mana. Once you have milled your library, you can use cards like Balustrade Spy and Undercity Informer to put Thassa's Oracle on top of your library and win the game with its enter-the-battlefield ability.

This Dimir Tempo deck focuses on disrupting opponents with counterspells and hand disruption while quickly deploying threats to finish the game. Utilizing cards like Force of Will, Hymn to Tourach, and Reanimate to control the board and disrupt the opponent's strategy. The deck also includes powerful threats like Murktide Regent and Brazen Borrower to apply pressure on the opponent. This deck aims to control the game tempo, disrupt the opponent's plans, and quickly close out the game with efficient threats.

This deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's hand and board with cards like Thoughtseize, Hymn to Tourach, and Fatal Push while maintaining tempo and card advantage with cards like Ponder, Brainstorm, and Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student. The deck also utilizes efficient creatures like Murktide Regent, Barrowgoyf, Nethergoyf, and Kaito, Bane of Nightmares to deal damage quickly. Additionally, it takes advantage of the versatility of counter spells like Force of Will and Daze to protect its board. Ultimately, the deck aims to control the game while applying pressure to the opponent.

This deck prioritizes playing aggressively and maintaining control early in the game. It focuses on powerful creatures with disruptive abilities such as Witch Enchanter, Archon of Emeria, and Elite Spellbinder. The inclusion of cards like Chalice of the Void and Palace Jailer helps to disrupt opponents' strategies while also providing card advantage. The deck also utilizes mana acceleration with cards like Chrome Mox and Lotus Petal to quickly establish board presence. This combination of aggro creatures and disruptive cards allows the deck to take the lead and maintain it throughout the game.
